title: Power - power delivered by constant force

content.description: A block is pushed up an incline with a rough surface at a constant speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>v</mi> </math> with a constant force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>F</mi></math> which is parallel to the incline, as shown in the figure. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the incline is <math alttext="mu sub k" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <msub> <mi>Î¼</mi> <mi>k</mi> </msub> </math>.
content.question: When the constant force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> moves the block up the incline at speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, the power delivered to the block by <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is <math alttext="P sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. When <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> moves the block up the incline with speed <math alttext="2 v" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></math>, the power delivered to the block by <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is <math alttext="P sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="P sub 1, to P sub 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>P</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>:</mo> <msub> <mi>P</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
